abstract.text: Ensures the shaders in the render pass’s subsequent draw commands have access to a resource.

You can make a resource
resident
(available in GPU memory) for the remaining duration of the render pass by calling this method. Call the method before encoding draw calls that may access
through an argument buffer. The method ensures the resource is in a format that’s compatible with the shaders that depend on it.
You don’t need to call this method if you bind a resource to a shader stage.
For example, you can explicitly bind resources for the vertex stage with the methods in the
collection.
The method also informs Metal when to apply hazard tracking for a resource you create with
. For a resource you create with
, you need to apply an
or an
to account for potential reading and writing hazards.
You can reconfigure an individual resource’s
options for subsequent draw calls in the same render pass by calling this method again.
Apps typically call the method for a resource in an argument buffer as a part of their
bindless
implementation. For more information about argument buffers and bindless implementations, see
and
, respectively.

abstract.text: Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
A simple semaphore to synchronize access to Metal resources.
A memory fence to capture, track, and manage resource dependencies across command encoders.
An option specifying that Metal prevents hazards when modifying this object’s contents.
An option specifying that the app must prevent hazards when modifying this object’s contents.
An interface that encodes a render pass into a command buffer, including all its draw calls and configuration.
Ensures the shaders in the render pass’s subsequent draw commands have access to a resource.
Ensures the shaders in the render pass’s subsequent draw commands have access to multiple resources.
Ensures the shaders in the render pass’s subsequent draw commands have access to multiple resources.
The stages in a render pass that triggers a synchronization command.
The fragment rendering stage.
The mesh rendering stage.
The object rendering stage.
The tile rendering stage.
The vertex rendering stage.
An allocation of memory accessible to a GPU.
Options that describe how a graphics or compute function uses an argument buffer’s resource.
An option that enables reading from the resource.
An option that enables writing to the resource.
Optimize your app’s performance by grouping your resources into argument buffers.

doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Meta.title: Improving CPU Performance by Using Argument Buffers

abstract.text: Organize your resources into groups and influence when they become accessible to the GPU.

doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Meta.title: Simplifying GPU Resource Management with Residency Sets

abstract.text: Optimize resource performance within an argument buffer.

doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Meta.title: Tracking the Resource Residency of Argument Buffers

abstract.text: Assign resources to vertex shaders, including buffers, textures, acceleration structures, sampler states, and function tables.
